question: Question_01_(e)
statement:
Let

\[A = \begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0 & 0 \\
0 & a & 0 \\
0 & 0 & 2
\end{bmatrix}\]

where \emph{a} is a real number.

\textbf{(e)} For what values of \emph{a} (if any) is \emph{cond(A) = 4}?
sols:
We use the three regions from
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH307/December_2010/Question_01_(d)}{part
(d)}.

\begin{itemize}
\itemsep1pt\parskip0pt\parsep0pt
\item
  Case 1: If $0 < |a| \leq 1$ then
\end{itemize}

\[\displaystyle
4 = \mathrm{cond}(A) = 2/|a|\]

has the solutions \emph{\textbar{}a\textbar{} = 1/2}, that is, \emph{a =
-1/2} and \emph{a = 1/2}.

\begin{itemize}
\itemsep1pt\parskip0pt\parsep0pt
\item
  Case 2: If $1 \leq |a| \leq 2$ then
\end{itemize}

\[\displaystyle
4 = \mathrm{cond}(A) = 2\]

has no solutions.

\begin{itemize}
\itemsep1pt\parskip0pt\parsep0pt
\item
  Case 3: If $2 \leq |a|$ then
\end{itemize}

\[\displaystyle
4 = \mathrm{cond}(A) = |a|\]

has the solutions \emph{a = -4} and \emph{a = 4}.

Overall we have that \emph{cond(A) = 4} holds if \emph{a = -4}, \emph{a
= -1/2}, \emph{a = 1/2} or \emph{a = 4}.
hints:
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH307/December_2010/Question_01_(d)}{Part
(d)} suggests that some solutions for \emph{a} exist. Find them by using
the piecewise defined function mapping \emph{a} to \emph{cond(A)} found
in
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH307/December_2010/Question_01_(d)}{Part
(d)}.
